author: ashithanagesh
title: White House press secretary accidentally sends distress signal
text:
Oops (Picture: AP) Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, accidentally delivered a briefing with his American flag pin on upside down.
According to the US Flag Code, an upside-down flag is ‘a signal of dire distress in instances of extreme danger’.
So, naturally, everyone thought this was a cry for help. A hilarious cry for help.
Writer Erin Gloria Ryan tweeted that her headline would be ‘Metaphor Delivers Press Conference’.
And Matt Negrin posted: ‘Spicer with his flag pin upside-down, told it’s upside-down, and “fixing” it but leaving it upside down, is the best meataphor for the Trump WH [White House].’
Sean Spicer's American flag pin is upside down. Upside down flag is a distress symbol. Headline: Metaphor Delivers Press Conference.
— Erin Gloria Ryan (@morninggloria) March 10, 2017 
spicer with his flag pin upside-down, told it's upside-down, & "fixing" it but leaving it upside-down, is the best metaphor for the Trump WH
— Mдтт Иegяiи (@MattNegrin) March 10, 2017

— darth™ (@darth) March 10, 2017 
Is Spicer's upside down flag lapel pin a distress signal? Blink twice if you need help, Sean. pic.twitter.com/hORrfBD94n 
— Maggie Serota (@maggieserota) March 10, 2017 
UPSIDE DOWN FLAG PIN! SPICER IS COMPROMISED! INITIATE OPERATION SPICER EVAC!!! pic.twitter.com/7Ujd4sb4eR

But the pin didn’t really caught the eye of House of Cards – the show whose official logo is the upside-down flag.

Maybe he’s a fan?
